enjoy.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Sandra enjoys her job in the city.
I enjoyed every minute of it.
Young children enjoy helping around the house.
Julia was just starting to enjoy herself.
enjoy.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to have a particular ability or advantage
enjoy.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: These workers enjoy a high level of job security.
enjoy.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with enjoy
enjoy.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: Enjoy is usually transitive You enjoy something
enjoy.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: I enjoyed watching the game on TV
enjoy.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: Enjoy is never followed by an infinitive
I enjoyed to watch the game on TV
enjoy.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3: In informal English, you sometimes use Enjoy! on its own, when saying that you hope someone enjoys something
enjoy.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used to say that you hope someone gets pleasure from something you give them
enjoy.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to use a legal right and benefit from it
enjoy.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Local producers enjoy tariff protection at home.
enjoy.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to experience something good such as high profits or increased sales
enjoy.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The company’s computer division has enjoyed revenue growth this year.
He claimed that oil companies enjoyed windfall profits as a result of the Gulf War.
